name: Realism
description: A style of art that aims to depict the subject matter in a truthful and objective way, without any exaggeration or idealization

name: Impressionism
description: A style of art that emphasizes the use of light, color, and movement to capture the impressions of a moment or a scene

name: Cubism
description: A style of art that breaks down the subject matter into geometric shapes and rearranges them to create multiple perspectives

name: Surrealism
description: A style of art that uses elements of fantasy, dream, and the subconscious to create a sense of irrationality and surprise

name: Abstract art
description: A style of art that does not depict realistic objects or scenes, but rather uses color, shape, and form to create a visual experience

name: Pop art
description: A style of art that uses imagery from popular culture, such as advertisements, comic books, and consumer products, to comment on society and consumerism

name: Fauvism
description: A style of art characterized by vibrant colors, bold brushstrokes, and a lack of detail, that emerged in the early 20th century

name: Expressionism
description: A style of art that emphasizes the artist's inner emotions and feelings, often using distorted forms and non-naturalistic colors

name: Futurism
description: A style of art that celebrates the modern world, technology, and the machine age, often using dynamic and geometric shapes

name: Dadaism
description: A style of art that emerged during World War I as a reaction to the absurdity and horror of the war, often using found objects and collage

name: Op art
description: A style of art that uses optical illusions and geometric patterns to create a sense of movement and depth

name: Minimalism
description: A style of art that emphasizes simplicity, reduction, and the use of basic geometric shapes and monochromatic colors

name: Renaissance art
description: A style of art that emerged in the 14th century in Italy, characterized by a renewed interest in classical art and culture, realism, and the use of linear perspective

name: Baroque art
description: A style of art that emerged in the late 16th century in Italy, characterized by grandeur, drama, movement, and emotional intensity

name: Romanticism
description: A style of art that emerged in the late 18th century, characterized by emotion, imagination, and a fascination with the natural world

name: Art Nouveau
description: A style of art and architecture that emerged in the late 19th century, characterized by organic forms, asymmetry, and the use of new materials, such as iron and glass

name: Art Deco
description: A style of art and architecture that emerged in the 1920s, characterized by geometric shapes, bold colors, and the use of new materials, such as stainless steel and plastic

name: Abstract Expressionism
description: A style of art that emerged in the 1940s in the United States, characterized by the use of large canvases, gestural brushstrokes, and the exploration of the unconscious

name: Conceptual art
description: A style of art that emerged in the 1960s, characterized by the use of ideas and concepts as the primary medium of expression, rather than the traditional art forms

name: Neo-expressionism
description: A style of art that emerged in the 1970s and 1980s, characterized by the use of bright colors, bold brushstrokes, and the return to figuration, often with an emotional and symbolic content
